Articles.Content:
I sent a rover to Eve to complete a contract where I need to make ground contact on Eve and splash down into the oceans of Eve. In this map (pls ignore my horrible drawing skills) the location of t the rover is the red X and I need to complete the splash down into the oceans of Eve part of the contract. If to complete the contract I just need to send my rover to water then i can go to the lake north of the rover location (black path), but if i really need to go to a ocean then i need to take the white path. Any path takes around 1h so my question is: does it need to be a ocean or just anything with water?

Edited July 26, 2021 by guituga---

I don't know for sure, but there is no biome named "oceans" on Eve. The ocean biomes all have individual names like "eastern sea" and so on.

Thus I would guess that it doesn't refer to any specific biome, and you could likely complete the contract by achieving the splashed down situation anywhere.

 

Edited July 27, 2021 by Streetwind

as far as i understand, it wants your rover to have the "splashed" condition, which requires landing in water. no need to have a biome named "ocean". in fact, no need to get a liquid biome at all; somebody achieved the "splashed" condition on kerbin's desert, because there are a couple oasis
Ok, thanks for anwsering my question @Streetwind  and @king of nowhere!
